climbs.name: Unknown 3
climbs.fa: K. Smith, K. Ariza, B. Baldwin '83

content.description: Follow this weird crack system up and left, then at a nice ledge trend up and right.  The crux (and fun) of it might be finding the best pro placements.
content.protection:
doubles #0.4 to #3 (and I used every piece).  Old fixed anchors are set back right, but it is better to build your own belay at the top of the climb with finger size pro.  I would

not

rap off the bolts.
content.location: This crack is located in the middle of the slab.  It trends left then back right.

content.description: Lieback and jam up the well-protected arching crack to a small stance.  Continue straight up passing some wide pods and mantle to the top (crux).
content.protection: Pro to #2.  No fixed anchors, easy downclimb west.
content.location: This climb follows the arching hand crack that is left of Unknown 1.

content.description: Follow the crack to it's end.
content.protection: Pro to #2, no fixed anchors.  Easy downclimb west
content.location: This is the first wide crack on the left right of the slab, just right of a prominent left-facing corner.

content.description: Not sure why it's called Freeway Jam, as this fun face climb requires sustained edging and smearing.  I should note on the traverse to the final bolt there are several flexing holds that are ready to break.  A great climb nonetheless.
content.protection:
4 bolts and bolted anchors but I would

not

advise clipping these homemade hangers.  It is safer to TR then walk-off west.
content.location: This climb goes directly up the middle of the slab just right of Unknown 3. See the beta photo for Unknown 3 for details.
